image.altText: Conjoined newborn twins lie amongst blankets in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: The parents of conjoined twins in PNG who were hoping to send their babies to Sydney for an operation are now trying to go to Germany instead because Australia is too expensive

title.children: Hopes for German miracle as conjoined twins priced out of Sydney surgery

image.altText: A woman sits inside a room with a lamp in background, smiling at camera.

props.synopsis: Older Australians were promised "a world class aged care system", but as "once in a generation" changes roll out, some feel they are being delivered anything but.

title.children: New aged care reforms roll out leaving some 'shocked' by their new fees

image.altText: A close up of Anthony Albanese smiling.

props.synopsis: The PM and his government are sitting in the often-fleeting sweet spot that comes early in the second term under our Westminster system of government.

title.children: Spectres of stagflation and soaring bills haunt Albanese's salad days

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu

props.synopsis: Zohran Mamdani, the man many predict will become New York City's next mayor, has made plenty of promises — his one to arrest Israel's PM is causing a particular stir ahead of Tuesday's election.

title.children: 'Unenforceable pledge' to arrest Netanyahu in New York gains traction

image.altText: A digitally blended composite image comprised of people and the RBA

props.synopsis: And until someone — redundant workers, big business, the RBA or government — foots the bill, interest rates are unlikely to budge from here.

title.children: Why interest rates will not fall again until someone pays the price

image.altText: Prince Andrew and his former wife Sarah Ferguson in 2025

props.synopsis: Andrew remains the subject of a mystery many are flummoxed by. The king's brother has not had a paid job for large chunks of his life, yet somehow he has managed to fund a luxury lifestyle.

title.children: Prince Andrew hasn't had a paid job but he's managed to fund a luxury lifestyle

image.altText: A 65-year-old former Prince Andrew.

props.synopsis: Sky Roberts also appealed to King Charles to pressure Donald Trump into putting "big boy pants on" over the release of the Epstein files.

title.children: Virginia Giuffre's brother calls for Prince Andrew to be investigated

image.altText: High Court exterior

props.synopsis: Human rights lawyers have applied to intervene in the High Court case of a man facing deportation to Nauru, arguing the government should be barred from deporting people to places where they face death or serious harm.

title.children: Lawyers move to block Nauru deportations over lack of adequate healthcare

image.altText: A mushroom cloud from a nuclear weapons test in a desert.

props.synopsis: The US has not conducted nuclear weapons testing for 33 years. Now Donald Trump is calling for a resumption, raising concerns about what that may involve.

title.children: What it could look like if the US resumes testing nuclear weapons

image.altText: Man in suit and tie surrounded by journalists.

props.synopsis: Dutch centrist party D66 is now expected to take the lead in a first round of talks to form a coalition government.

title.children: Dutch centrist leader Rob Jetten claims 'historic' win in Netherlands election

image.altText: Grey skies and light rain over Qunaba in Queensland

props.synopsis: Australia's storm season shifts into top gear, and the next 72 hours will deliver a combination of rain, showers or thunderstorms to the eastern two-thirds of the country.

title.children: 'Very dangerous' supercell storms could bring potential tornadoes, giant hail

image.altText: Annapurna towers four vertical kilometres over base camp

props.synopsis: An Australian mountaineer dies while descending one of Nepal's highest peaks.

title.children: Australian climber dies on Nepal's Himlung Himal

image.altText: Sold signs real estate Sydney

props.synopsis: NSW sees a 16.8 per cent increase in new property listings during spring — ringing true to the age-old saying this time of year is the best time to jump into the housing market.

title.children: Why spring sends buyers into overdrive in the property market

image.altText: A glass vial full of white powder sitting next to a petri dish of dark grey ore.

props.synopsis: Researchers warn Australia's pursuit of a critical minerals industry could come at a significant cost.

title.children: True cost of critical minerals becomes clearer amid chase for holy grail

image.altText: An older woman with glasses looks sad, looking past the camera.

props.synopsis: Widespread farm crime is frustrating rural communities, with almost 90 per cent of farmers in New South Wales reporting they have been victims.

title.children: Most Australian farmers have been victims of crime, survey reveals

image.altText: Alex De Minaur looks skyward in frustration during a match

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur suffers another nightmarish defeat in Paris at the hands of his old tormentor Alexander Bublik.

title.children: De Minaur upset by familiar foe again in Paris

image.altText: A man in a dark-blue shirt stands in the middle of a winery with bottles light up on the walls.

props.synopsis: From wine in 187ml bottles to spirits in sleek aluminium cans, producers are downsizing to meet a growing demand for convenience and variety.

title.children: Alcohol industry explores smaller packaging for 'promiscuous' customers

image.altText: A slightly run-down wood panel house with a neatly mown lawn.

props.synopsis: The median house price in regional Victoria is $636,500. But what that will get you can look very different from place to place.

title.children: What does the average house price get you in regional Victoria?

image.altText: A close shot of Brereton, who is sitting in the offices of the new national anti--corruption commission

props.synopsis: The head of the National Anti-Corruption Commission will step away from all defence-related corruption referrals following questions over his handling of perceived conflicts of interest.

title.children: National anti-corruption chief steps away from all defence investigations

image.altText: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.

props.synopsis: A Master Builders Association of Victoria board member fails in their bid to identify the person who made a complaint about their conduct — provoking a colourful ruling from the presiding judge.

title.children: Bid to unmask complainant in board dispute likened to John Grisham novel

image.altText: A woman sits at her desk with her laptop.

props.synopsis: Patients are calling for better access to long COVID care after the closure of one of the country's last public clinics.

title.children: Long COVID patients seeking help 'let down by the system'

image.altText: A female high school student sitting on a playground.

props.synopsis: The close-knit community in one of Australia's last remaining company towns has celebrated the graduation of the only year 12 student from its remote school.

title.children: Graduate Sea Sokra'a in a class of her own at Leinster

image.altText: Jamaican men walking past large piles of debris and the collapsed roofs of destroyed homes

props.synopsis: The death toll in the wake of Hurricane Melissa has climbed to at least 49, according to official reports, after wreaking destruction across much of the northern Caribbean.

title.children: Hurricane Melissa death toll rises to at least 49 as clean-up continues

image.altText: A young woman and an older lady smiling

props.synopsis: The mother of 21-year-old Finley Bone, who was struck by lightning and later died, says her daughter's life was "taken away in a minute".

title.children: Lightning strike kills talented sportswoman on soccer field

image.altText: A weather radar being displayed on a phone, in front of a different radar on a computer screen

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will revert to its previous colour scheme on its rain radar and weather map following a wave of complaints about its new $4.1 million website.

title.children: BOM reverts to previous rain radar after wave of complaints

image.altText: A coal-fired power station on an overcast day

props.synopsis: AGL is preparing to shed hundreds jobs as part of a massive restructure aimed at freeing up capital to accelerate its transition away from coal and towards renewables.

title.children: AGL to shed hundreds of coal jobs and accelerate green transition

image.altText: North Melbourne plays stand arm in arm to sing the team song after a win

props.synopsis: North Melbourne becomes the first male or female VFL/AFL team to win 24 consecutive games after prevailing over Hawthorn by 49 points.

title.children: North makes history with 24th consecutive AFLW win

image.altText: homemade chilli paste collage

props.synopsis: Queensland Health says the three products were made in a home kitchen and were either gifted or purchased in the local area.

title.children: Homemade food items confirmed as rat poisoning source, sixth case identified

image.altText: Josh Hazlewood in green and gold cricket attire with the number '38', celebrating with his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: A lethal spell from Josh Hazlewood has propelled Australia to an emphatic four-wicket Twenty20 win over India in front of 82,438 fans at the MCG.

title.children: Hazlewood and Marsh dominate T20 as Australia beat India at MCG

image.altText: A man in a wide brim hat and sunglasses has a guitar strapped on and leans against a car

props.synopsis: From indie rock to children's TV icon, David McCormack has done it all — and now he's back with a new album and zero expectations.

title.children: David McCormack on the power of pop music and the beauty of Bluey

image.altText: A building with brown designer facade that says Shepparton Law Courts.

props.synopsis: A jury has found a 29-year-old Vanuatu national guilty of the rape and abduction of a woman in Shepparton in August last year.

title.children: Man found guilty of raping woman he found unconscious on nature strip

image.altText: Marnus Labuschagne looks at the cricket ball he has just hit during a Test match

props.synopsis: Marnus Labuschagne is prepared to do whatever it takes to get back into Australia's Test side, even if that means batting in a non-preferred opening slot.

title.children: Labuschagne throws hand up to open batting in bid to claim Ashes spot

image.altText: Hundreds of men wearing suits and hats crowded in a street and in buildings.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of ultra-orthodox Jews have shut down one of the busiest junctions at the entrance to Jerusalem in protest against moves to force them to serve in the Israeli military.

title.children: 'We are against its mere existence': Ultra-orthodox Israelis reject country and army service
